boat.name: Rosa and Ada
boat.full_description:
'Rosa & Ada' was built at Whitstable, Kent in 1908 as an oyster smack. The last and biggest smack built by Collar Bros., she worked with the Seasalter andHam Oyster Co. at Whitstable until 1963. In 1921, a petrol-paraffin engine was installed and she was requisitioned as a supply tender in the Thames during the Second World War.

During the 1950s whe was restored and used for racing in Kent. She was advertised for sale in the OGA Newsletters 1979 and 1980 by A R Winter of Faversham: "All spars, rigging and sails overhauled 1978-79. No engine. Vessel re-rigged 1972 and returned to original appearance. Asking price £13,000."

She was sold to a Scottish owner who installed an engine and took her to Scotland where she has been sailed as a charter vessel since 1981.

Take a look at this archive video from British Movietone, undated but likely to be in the 1970s, showing 'Rosa and Ada', F105, taking part in the annual Thames Oyster Smack Race from Gravesend to Billingsgate.
boat.short_description: 'Rosa and Ada', a Whitstable oyster smack, was built in 1908 by Collar Bros., Whitstable, Kent. After conversion to a yacht in the 1950s she was taken to Scotland where she still sails as a charter vessel.
